poem.title: Ecclesiasticus
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Lust wasn't him. He'd never Lurked in puissant shades But just lucked out, you know? Could call it providence. Lunched with a visiting big man, Lurched enthusiastically. Lumped together with ships of state In diplomatic channels he luffed And tacked. Tact, yes, that was him, A touch of vanity.
